intro: Crotalaria tepicana, commonly known as the Mexican crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its leguminous properties, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Crotalaria tepicana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important plant in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
